intro: Chrysodium vulgare, commonly known as the common chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Chrysodium vulgare prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively easy to care for in gardens.
